channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This is what history shows after big stock-market jumps like this one
item.description: There have been eight instances of 36%+ S&P 500 rallies over 52 weeks since 1995

item.title: I inherited $200,000. One of my daughters is married with kids, but the other has debts. Do I split my windfall 50/50?
item.description: “She has incurred a lot of debt due to the financial strain of a sick pet, a car loan, student loans and an unpaid military home loan.”

item.title: Dow Futures, Bond Yields Edge Down Ahead of Inflation Gauge
item.description: Stock futures edged lower ahead of October consumer-price index data.

item.title: Sterling Faces Hit From Repricing of U.K. Rate-Cut Bets
item.description: Sterling fell against the dollar and looks vulnerable to a potential repricing of the market’s cautious interest-rate cut expectations for the BOE, IN...

item.title: German Bunds Seen Staying Rangebound, More Attractive Than U.S. Treasurys
item.description: The 10-year Bund yield was higher and is expected to trade in a range of 2.20%-2.50%, as Jefferies said it is more inclined to buy Bunds rather than T...

item.title: Spotify Delivers a Strong Encore
item.description: The music streamer’s growing profit margins should keep its gravity-defying stock in orbit.

item.title: Blackstone's New Fund for the Rich Is Looking Just About Everywhere for Deals
item.description: Competitors question whether deals the fund has done on its own have been as attractive.

item.title: ‘I’ve no interest in investing more money in the stock market’: I’m debt-free, retired and ignoring the ‘Trump bump.’ What should I do with $400,000?
item.description: “I already have $1.5 million in the stock market.”

item.title: AI is changing our money and investing habits — and it’s just the beginning
item.description: Financial markets will need much stronger firewalls if regulators hope to control AI’s impact.

item.title: My grandmother gave her neighbor $6,000 to buy a car. There was no car. How can I protect her from further exploitation?
item.description: “The neighbor is living it up and — lo and behold! — there is no vehicle.”
